full_text: To become a Leader it is important that we are inclusive of industry, agriculture, NGOs, government and academia that is why I am holding this consultative forum to hear their voices as we develop our policy tools https://t.co/WzJMK6II0H
Today I will hold a summit on All of Government Climate Plan bringing together stakeholders to discuss how we can make Ireland a Leader on Climate
Great to chat to students from local schools @StFintansHS @SPSSutton @PSNeasain & @santasabina_ie about their very interesting projects at the @BTYSTE today https://t.co/LflmrESLid

Today I announced funding to support small businesses with online services. It was great to chat to local business owner Sinead of @galvinsports about her positive experience with the scheme and how it helped her to grow and develop her business https://t.co/hapkkQhT9K

Congratulations to the 34 groups from Dublin Bay North whose projects successfully won support from the Community Enhancement Programme which will invest over €350,000 across each project. https://t.co/g7GlpSXVjG
Speaking about the importance of community leadership in tackling litter at the @IrishLitter awards this morning. Congratulations to Fermoy for winning cleanest town https://t.co/Lld7EEPgwz
Will be on @morningireland and @BreakfastNT shortly to speak about today’s announcement that the government will take the lead on cutting down on single use plastics

Every year the public service spends €12 billion in procuring goods, services and works. By adopting green procurement, not only will government lead by example, but also help create a new market for sustainable goods and services
The govt also approved plans to cut waste in food and paper, to improve efficiency in the use of energy & water and to reshape procurement to choose sustainable options

From today, no government department or agency will buy single-use plastic cups, cutlery or straws for use within their offices. The govt must be the first to show that it takes policies for sustainability seriously, if we are to persuade the rest of society to make changes

Through the Climate Action Fund the government is providing up to €10 million to ESB ecars to develop a nationwide, state-of-the-art electric vehicle charging network capable of facilitating large-scale electric vehicle uptake over the next decade. https://t.co/eXGk9LUjW0
Delighted to be in Brussels today to attend my first EU Environment Council as Minister for Communications, Climate Action and Environment https://t.co/qco2rhJMnj

Separately, I am working with government colleagues across the board to identify tangible actions and secure commitments to step up our ambition across government. I will publish this all of government plan early in the new year.

Following a decision at yesterday's cabinet meeting, I am today publishing the draft Energy and Climate Plan which we are legally obliged to submit to the Commission by the end of the year.  https://t.co/MPFRwvvxun
Congratulations to @alavin1 and @AoibhinnTormey selected to run for Fine Gael in the upcoming local elections https://t.co/VILOtscV9r
I have signed a commitment to work together with my European counterparts on more ambitious carbon pricing measures -https://t.co/BSQq1c7tzN
I will be speaking at @COP24 in the next 5 minutes-you can watch here: https://t.co/h1KgkJeUZH
Meeting with the Danish Minister for Energy Lars Christian at the United Nations Climate Change Conference COP24 this morning https://t.co/RpDiK8BpMQ

CCPI 2019 highlights the fact that we are far off course in our response to climate change. I recently secured government approval to develop an all of government plan to make Ireland a leader in responding to climate change. Todays report reinforces the urgency of this work

Parents & guardians of children 0-5 in the Donaghmede/Howth/Dublin13 & Killester/Raheny/Clontarf catchments areas are invited to express parental preference for the patronage of the new primary schools to be established in September 2019. https://t.co/nihJxZAlr5
Well done to @ClontarfGAAClub great result to round off a great year! https://t.co/zIlbAHeShz

There have been significant savings this year-€608m was saved & 667,000 tns of CO2 emissions avoided. However while some bodies are doing well, others are not. Significant progress could be made if health, some areas of education & commercial state bodies reached their targets

In @DublinCityUni today to launch a report on the energy efficiency of public sector bodies. If we want to be a leader in responding to climate change, we need to lead by example SEAI_ie https://t.co/ggIeFIL6Kk

I will be speaking in the Dáil shortly about climate change and how we need to a make a significant step change across government. I will be developing an all of government plan on climate action. You can watch here: https://t.co/pvPS92lb0u
With @MurphyEoghan at the @EIB investing for the future forum to discuss how we can finance Climate Action https://t.co/dRIzOv0Z7T
Speaking at the open policy forum of transparency of online political advertising in Dublin Castle this morning https://t.co/QfAAg14dLX
I will be speaking to the Climate Action Committee shortly about developing an all of government plan to tackle climate change. Looking forward to discussing this vital issue with the committee
I’ll be on @PatKennyNT shortly to discuss our ambitious plans on climate and the National Broadband Plan

At the opening ceremony for @COP24 today, with representatives from all over the world to set out a course of action on climate change. Here with Joyce Murray, Parliamentary Secretary to the President of the Treasury Board and Minister of Digital Government of Canada https://t.co/Guhl1zR7jw
Introducing @campaignforleo to @RahenyGAA with @senatornoone and @naoiseomuiri https://t.co/Ictsg0IV1I
Welcoming @campaignforleo to Howth https://t.co/WQrhh4oWZm
Not easy on these cold days. Well done to Rang 4 keep it up! https://t.co/vPzzTANlV8
Finally then we will be supporting 1,000 vehicles from 3 counties to increase fuel efficiency by at least 10% over two years. The transport sector is crucial to helping us reach our goals

Up to €17.5m will be invested to retrofit all remaining 326,000 non-LED Local authority public lights to high efficiency LED Lanterns. This project will reduce emissions from electricity generation per year by over 40,000 tonnes a year

Irish Rail will be designing new hybrid power packs for railcars to reduce diesel use & emissions  Gas Networks Ireland will be installing 1st transmission connected Central Grid Injection faculty for renewable gas & a grant scheme to support 74 compressed natural gas vehicles

Congratulations to all the successful projects-   ESB will be funded to develop a network of chargers for electric cars,    Both Dublin City Council and South Dublin County Council will be funded to develop district heating for up to 60,000 homes (cont) https://t.co/pRJ4OE4lNT
These 7 projects will reduce our annual emissions by at least 200,000 tonnes of carbon per year

We want Ireland to be a leader in responding to climate change. Today’s announcement, which will see 7 major projects share €77m in govt funding (leveraging €300m overall) under round one of the Climate Action Fund, will make a significant impact to reaching our targets https://t.co/SzG5EhUBrL
Speaking to the Irish Solar Energy Association about increasing the use of renewable energy and the development of an all of government plan to tackle climate change https://t.co/kh00V36RIR
Well done to @naoiseomuiri & @jeff_johnston_  selected as Fine Gael candidates in next May’s local elections for the Clontarf Ward. https://t.co/rdC3YT2VqL

The cost of not becoming a leader on climate is not just environmental, it is financial. Missing our 2020 co2 targets will cost Ireland €6-13m. Missing our renewables targets by 4% could cost €90m or more. Development of a Climate Action Plan vital  https://t.co/psClWmkgQc

I said on my appointment that putting in place a trajectory for carbon taxation to 2030 would be important if we are to respond to climate change. Suggestion by @EamonRyan that each party should sign up to a 2030 trajectory is a positive one and I welcome the Taoiseach's support

Today I secured government approval to draw up an all of government plan to make Ireland a leader in responding to climate change. The Plan will set out the actions to be taken by every government department and body to meet our climate commitments
At the Climate Action session at the #fgaf18 project Ireland 2040 will be key to Ireland becoming a leader in this area https://t.co/QFHWVyqj3V
At the making life easier for families session at #fgaf18 https://t.co/1TzgMLIDZn
In Sutton for a Q&A with Active Retirement Ireland this morning https://t.co/wvL9sWFQiJ

Very interesting discussion on transitioning to a low carbon economy this morning with CEOs and business leaders from across the board. Great to see leadership from the 43 companies who have pledged to reduce their emissions by 50% by 2030 @BITCIreland https://t.co/cGjf2NlaKl
Speaking at the #CEOForum18 about developing an all of government plan to make Ireland a leader in responding to climate change ⁦@BITCIreland⁩ https://t.co/FDwLvSQfZE
Discussing careers in politics with @naoiseomuiri and students from Maryfield College for their careers day https://t.co/KZrRHLfSHJ

At @SciFest4STEM in @MarinoInstitute chatting to students from Santa Sabina, Sutton and @mountrathcs about their projects. Well done to everyone on their very innovative projects https://t.co/gjqsvTWE58

School patrons can now apply for the patronage of two new primary schools to be established in September 2019 in Donaghmede_Howth_D13 and Killester_Raheny_Clontarf  https://t.co/Ai0h1lTZOx  This will provide key information to parents and guardians for their preferred patron
In St Fintan’s NS Sutton with @unicefireland for the world’s largest lesson discussing sustainable development goals https://t.co/rDjSDfoNEZ
Speaking at the Investment Plan for Europe Financing Energy Efficiency https://t.co/gvYjN3uWdQ

Increasing Carbon taxes will have a strong role to play and I believe that we need to set a trajectory for increasing carbon taxes between now and 2030. It is important that people have this certainty.
Price matters when it comes to choices. We must discourage new private or public investments being made now which lock us in to high carbon patterns of living.

I will be seeking to work with colleagues across govt to develop new initiatives across electricity, transport, heat, as well as a range of other sectors. The focus will be on implementation. We will identify actions with clear timelines & the steps needed to get there.

I want to make Ireland a leader in responding to climate change, not a follower. That will require a significant step change across govt. I will lead on the development of an all of govt plan which will set out the actions which must be taken in every government dept and body.
The decisions we make now in tackling climate change will define the next century.
Speaking at Dublin Castle today at the EU Climate-KIC summit https://t.co/fQW2WTGZY6
Well done to the Intermediate Clontarf Ladies Footballers on winning the Leinster Final today https://t.co/s7IPzDVwoh

In @ITTallaght this morning to launch two new apprenticeships schemes for BioPharmaChem Ireland. These apprenticeships form part of our Governement’s wider national strategy to increase registrations to 50,000 by 2020. https://t.co/TmdOxIJemk
On @TodaySOR with Miriam now on my priorities in the new role https://t.co/vdQmoMnQAK

Congratulations to Educate Together on winning the patronage competition for the new 1,000 pupil secondary school for the Clongriffin Belmayne area and Foras Pátrúnachta on the award of patron of a new 200 pupil Gaelscoil in the Drumcondra_Marino_Dublin1 area.
Great achievement well done Mick https://t.co/MxsVZ0mqvl

The EU proposal includes: - A ban on certain plastic products - Targets for reducing the use of certain plastics  -Obligations for producers to cover the costs of waste management and clean up. - Obligations on states to collect 90% of plastic bottles placed on the market
Plastic is one of the main causes of chronic ocean pollution. Tackling plastic waste and increasing the level of plastic recycling is a key priority of mine during my time as minister
I fully support the EU Commission’s proposal for a directive to manage Single Use Plastic waste and will work with my colleagues across Europe to see these proposals enacted into law
Just voted no. 1 for Michael D Higgins, he has been a great president over the past 7 years  #IVoted #VoteYes #BlasphemyRef #Aras18. https://t.co/wOwbuLCCVm

In @News_St_Marys_B this morning to open their new meditation room - a great initiative providing a dedicated space for wellbeing for the school community. Best of luck to the students who are hosting trick or treat for Temple Street in the school today https://t.co/Wp9r7PTj2T
https://t.co/BSpYl05NWe

Bord na Móna is also acknowledging that Climate Change is our biggest challenge globally. More generally, the Midlands has had strong employment growth in recent years, with 15,300 extra people at work since 2015.

All relevant State supports are available to the workers impacted by today’s announcement. Bord na Móna will provide add supports to workers who opt for redundancy, incl reskilling opps. The Govt welcomes the extensive consultation which will now take place with workers

Bord na Móna have confirmed that they will seek these redundancies on a voluntary basis. Crucially today’s announcement is expected to provide for long-term, sustainable employment for the Midlands – incl 400-500 jobs in new areas, such as renewable energy & resource recovery

Today is a difficult day for many Bord na Mona workers and their communities. However, Bord na Móna is taking the steps it needs to take now, to continue to contribute to providing good and sustainable jobs in the Midlands for many years to come.
Celebrating 25 years with RASP this morning. Well done to everyone involved in reaching this milestone https://t.co/vzS0QbWR0N

Opening a new €6.7m Digital Sales Hub in East Wall this morning for @citrix. This new facility will ultimately employ over 400 employees and will be the largest centre for the company in Europe @IDAIRELAND https://t.co/BjjluGfItC
It's a great honour to be appointed as Minister for Communications, Climate Action and the Environment https://t.co/O6DBUlDuYD
Saying thank you and good bye to @Education_Ire. We achieved a lot together and I really enjoyed my time here. On to the next challenge! https://t.co/w2xk0ny3NZ
I’m delighted @campaignforleo has chosen me to lead on this crucial issue and am excited to take on the challenges and opportunities the new role will bring.

Looking forward to this new challenge, working on some of the most crucial issues currently facing the country. I am committed to implementing the National Broadband Plan, which will deliver broadband to over 500,000 homes, schools and businesses across the country.
https://t.co/7NgQ3kTB1M
I will be on @RTE_PrimeTime shortly to discuss this government’s continued commitment to the delivery of the National Broadband Plan
Will be on @ClareFM and @SouthEastRadio this morning on #budget2019 https://t.co/JbwgYyEWHr
I will be speaking to @morningireland  shortly about #BUDGET19

We are investing heavily in new pathways, skills, school leadership and local innovation. We also have the highest ever capital budget this year, as part of our plan to prepare for the future by investing in state of the art new schools, and in higher and further education

Education is key to our ability to adapt successfully during a period of very rapid change and considerable new challenges. This Budget is making the investments we need to ensure we equip Irish talent with the capacity to shape their future #Budget19
We are setting up a new €300m Fund to support priority skill needs of enterprise, drive regional development, and support key sectors in the Face of Brexit #Budget19
€150m capital investment will be allocated to the higher education, further education and training and research sectors in 2019 #Budget19

Higher Education will receive additional funding of €57m. This will provide funding for 2,100 additional students and initiatives to support innovation and performance awards @mitchelloconnor #Budget19
€50 million going to further roll-out investment in new technology in schools – a 40% increase on 2018 – in line with our ambition to embed computer science and coding across the curriculum #Budget19
Under Ireland #Project2040, we will deliver an ambitious school building programme, which will support the creation of up to 23,000 new and replacement school places in 2019 #Budget19

Ensuring those with special educational needs fulfil their full potential is a key priority, €5m will go towards implementing a new, more effective model for supporting children with additional care needs #Budget19
We must prepare our children for the challenges they face, 10 more psychologists will be working with our schools #Budget19
I will expand the School Excellence Fund to encourage and support local innovation by 25% to over €2.5m #Budget19
Education is central to achieving this Government’s overall objectives – securing a strong, future-proofed economy, balanced across the regions and a fair society #Budget19
We are planning for the future – this year we have highest ever capital investment- €941m #Budget19 https://t.co/03QxoixXVl

In further education we will provide funding to support 7,000 apprenticeship registrations, 5,000 traineeship enrolments and roll out 10 new apprenticeship schemes, in line with our overall commitment to double the number of apprenticeships.

A major new €300m Human Capital fund for 2020-2024 will position the higher education sector to meet the priority skills needs of enterprise, to drive regional jobs growth and development, and support key economic sectors in responding to the challenges of Brexit #budget19
Schools will receive a 5% increase in capitation from September 2019. This represents an additional investment of €10 million in 2019/20 academic year #budget19
#Budget19 will see staff numbers in schools reach their highest ever level – 1,300 additional posts in schools will be funded, including 950 additional SNAs
€675m increase in Education for #Budget19, helping us on our journey to becoming the best in Europe by 2026. €1.7 Billion extra investment in education since 2016.
@nikkerinas Thanks for your tweet. Those sections of the admissions act have been in operation since last week. See our statement here: https://t.co/5Pt5QLVXrR

I have signed the historic Commencement Order bringing a number of important sections on the Admissions to Schools Act 2018 into operation. This will include measures making it easier for a child to attend their local school https://t.co/FYFv4ESqXb

I will sign an order this morning to remove religion as a factor that can be used in admissions in virtually all primary schools. This applies from today. I will also bring into operation other key parts of the School Admissions Act to ensure greater fairness in admissions

Addressing the @ETBIreland conference this afternoon. This year’s theme of Diversity and Inclusion is apt. We must ensure that we are supporting all those who come through our education and training system to fulfil their ambitions and personal potential https://t.co/qvFN0xtsZ4
We will invest over €8bn in school buildings over the next 10 years as part of #ProjectIreland -a 70% increase over the previous 10 years
We want to have the best education and training service in Europe by 2026. State of the art facilities will be key to this and we are now building more school places than ever before
This new 24 classroom school will cater for 600 pupils and cost €8million to build
Great welcome from Stepaside Educate Together National School this morning for the opening of their new school @josephamadigan @Shane_RossTD @nealerichmond https://t.co/snX1QVufXj

The new deal complements the improvements to starting pay already made under the LRA which will see the starting salary of a teacher rise to €36,318 this year & further to €37,692 in 2020. Even in a tight labour market, these are very attractive starting salaries for graduates.

This change will mean for example a €3,600 increase by this time next year for a teacher who started in 2011, a €1,500 increase for a teacher who started in 2014 and a €1,000 increase for a teacher who started in 2016 on top of other pay changes already agreed.

I am delighted that the Government has been able to agree the deal announced today on restoration of pay for new entrant public servants. This deal provides for a series of incremental jumps for new entrants at the fourth and eighth points of their scale. https://t.co/1S503DG72l
Congratulations to @ardscoillasalle celebrating 50 years of education in Raheny. Here’s to many more years to come! https://t.co/0NoAtikiUQ
Under the School Excellence Fund I am announcing the schools that will be taking part in creative clusters around the country https://t.co/gLMpWzvvwL

Was an honour to meet both the Prime Minister of Malaysia Dr. Mahathir Mohamad and the Deputy Prime Minister Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail today. Dr Wan Azizah actually studied in @RCSI_Irl for her medical degree-a good indication of our two countries’ close educational ties https://t.co/wyJcJqM2N2

Meeting my Malaysian counterpart Minister for Education Dr Maszlee Malik. Great discussion around the historic links between our two countries and opportunities for future collaboration https://t.co/RS3wIFuhmw
Addressing the local network of business and education leaders for today’s @Entirl breakfast https://t.co/12hUrmuiwv

In Kuala Lumpur this morning for a series of agreements between Irish and Malaysian higher education institutions @Entirl @UL @AthloneIT @nuigalway @DBScollege @CIT_ie @MaynoothUni @DublinCityUni https://t.co/9Libabez6w

Addressing students of University of Malaya on Higher Education and the Industrial Revolution 4:0-the impact of future technologies and global challenges on education, the economy and society https://t.co/DKVFV3mk2E

@UL and University of Malaya have committed to a number of actions to deepen the collaboration between the two universities-mainly around student exchange, joint research, information exchange and dedicated visits @Entirl https://t.co/wpfkV0zuOu
@AthloneIT and the University of Malaya, Malaysia’s oldest university, have agreed to establishing a number of staff and student exchange programmes https://t.co/RZ2g1N2uOk

Very interesting discussion with Professor Dr. Azirah Hashim, Executive Director for the Asia Europe Institute in the University of Malaya about the Action Plan process, how it worked for Jobs and how we are currently implementing it afor Education https://t.co/vY48A3OnIZ

Launching the @RCSI_Irl @ucddublin Malaysia Campus in Penang this morning, one of only 10 foreign branch university branch campuses in Malaysia. Congratulations to all on this great achievement https://t.co/iINGKJtgfd
Speaking to students in Universitas Indonesia about Ireland’s education system and answering questions on what it would be like to study there https://t.co/4iF1fsOz8z
This morning, Universitas Indonesia, Indonesia’s largest university entered into agreements with @UL and @nuigalway @Entirl https://t.co/hWCqIA4WJA
Speaking at a reception for @Entirl Education in Ireland last night. Thank you all for such a warm welcome https://t.co/ht0dDc2BPB

Witnessing the signing of an agreement between @AthloneIT and BINUS university, which will bring more opportunities for academic, staff and student exchanges in the areas of software engineering and ICT https://t.co/PgdOPtauFs

Signed a MoU with the Indonesian Minister of Research, Technology and Higher Education which will deepen the cooperation between our two countries in the area of research and higher education. Here with Minister Nasir, our Ambassador Olivia Leslie and Giles O’Neill from @Entirl https://t.co/cDYAn9BEEu

Arrived in Indonesia for a five day education and trade mission -2 days in Jakarta and the remainder in Malaysia. I’m looking forward to a packed agenda aimed at increasing opportunities for Irish students to study here and international students to study in Ireland https://t.co/nsAzdcx91Z
Move over Mary Berry 🍰🎂🍩 . . . #bakeoff #newjudgeintown #richardbrutontd  https://t.co/jLogXahTMN https://t.co/QjDIlb10VD

Delighted to be visiting ⁦@GhlorNaMara⁩ this morning to announce €11.9 Billion investment in our schools and colleges over the next decade. Investment will deliver extra school places, PE hall build and modernisation programme, and school lab modernisation programme https://t.co/Gfb696fBT4

The investment under the NDP will have a transformative impact on our education system and take us further along our journey, to becoming the best in Europe #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040 https://t.co/GEf1jfVK7T

We will have the first ever capital budget for Further Education and Training under the NDP, which will see €300m invested over the next 10 years in modern, fit for purpose facilities #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040

We will be investing €2.8 billion in Higher Education over the lifetime of the NDP, a 10 fold increase in capital for the sector - €30m in 2018 rising to an annual average of approximately €300 million #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040

We are committing to a PE Hall build and modernisation programme, starting in the second half of the NDP period, that ensures that students in all post-primary schools have access to appropriate PE facilities #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040
Schools must have certainty with their budgets, we will provide this by paying the minor works grant annually in December or January #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040
We are giving schools, higher and further education institutions more certainty over the grants they receive and better lead in times, making it easier to plan #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040
Under the NDP we will double the budget for school buildings and there will be a ten fold increase in capital investment in Higher Education #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040

We are investing in modern, state of the art facilities in our schools, higher and further education institutions, which are energy efficient and fit for purpose for the curricular reforms we are making #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040

This €11.9 billion investment reflects the importance this government puts on education and will enable our ambition to make Ireland’s education and training service the best in Europe by 2026 #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040
Education is critical to planning for a strong, future-proofed economy, balanced across the regions and a fair society, removing barriers to opportunity #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040
Education is central to, and indeed enables our overall objectives under the National Development Plan #BestinEurope #ProjectIreland2040 https://t.co/CgmtQy4UZ7

The new Bachelor in Education through Irish for primary teaching in Marino Institute of Education which will commence in September 2019 represents an important advancement in the work that I am undertaking to increase the number of teachers who can teach through Irish

Tá áthas orm bheith anseo inniu in Institiúid Oideachais Marino. Tá conradh ocht mbliana sínithe Adam, don clár oideachais múinteoirí seo, idir Institúid Marino agus Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna. Infheistíocht €5.5m atá i gceist. Cuifear tús leis an gclár i Meán Fomhair 2019 https://t.co/CJPzIcJ6MX
